name: Exondys 51
use: To treat patients with Duchenne, muscular dystrophy

name: Adlyxin

name: Xiidra

name: Epclusa

name: NETSPOT

name: Axumin
use: A  new diagnostic imaging agent to detect recurrent prostate cancer

name: Ocaliva

name: Zinbryta
use: To treat multiple sclerosis

name: Tecentriq

name: Nuplazid

name: Venclexta

name: Defitelio

name: Cinqair
use: To treat severe asthma

name: Taltz
use: To treat adults with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis.

name: Anthim
use: To treat inhalational anthrax in combination with appropriate antibacterial drugs.

name: Briviact
use: To treat partial onset seizures in patients age 16 years and older with epilepsy.

name: Zepatier
use: To treat patients with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotypes 1 and 4 infections in adult patients.

name: Spinraza

name: Rubraca
use: To treat women with a certain type of ovarian cancer

name: Eucrisa
use: To treat mild to moderate eczema (atopic dermatitis) in patients two years of age and older

name: Zinplava
use: To reduce the recurrence of Clostridium difficile infection in patients aged 18 years or older

name: Lartruvo
use: To treat adults with certain types of soft tissue sarcoma

name: Ozempic
use: To improve glycemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus

name: Hemlibra
use: To prevent or reduce the frequency of bleeding episodes in adult and pediatric patients with hemophilia A who have developed antibodies called Factor VIII (FVIII) inhibitors

name: Mepsevii
use: To treat pediatric and adult patients with an inherited metabolic condition called mucopolysaccharidosis type VII (MPS VII)- also known as Sly syndrome.

name: Fasenra
use: For add-on maintenance treatment of patients with severe asthma aged 12 years and older- and with an eosinophilic phenotype

name: Prevymis
use: To prevent infection after bone marrow transplant

name: Vyzulta
use: To treat intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

name: Calquence
use: To treat adults with mantle cell lymphoma

name: Verzenio
use: To treat certain advanced or metastatic breast cancers

name: Solosec
use: To treat bacterial vaginosis

name: Aliqopa
use: To treat adults with relapsed follicular lymphoma

name: benznidazole
use: To treat children ages 2 to 12 years old with Chagas disease

name: Vabomere
use: To treat adults with complicated urinary tract infections

name: Besponsa
use: To treat adults with relapsed or refractory acute lymphoblastic leukemia

name: Mavyret
use: To treat adults with chronic hepatitis C virus

name: Idhifa

name: Vosevi
use: To treat adults with chronic hepatitis C virus

name: Nerlynx
use: To reduce the risk of breast cancer returning

name: Tremfya
use: For the treatment of adult patients with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis

name: Bevyxxa
use: For the prophylaxis of venous thromboembolism (VTE) in adult patients hospitalized for an acute medical illness

name: Baxdela
use: To treat patients with acute bacterial skin infections

name: Kevzara
use: To treat adult rheumatoid arthritis

name: Radicava
use: To treat patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)

name: Imfinzi
use: To treat patients with locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma

name: Tymlos
use: To treat osteoporosis in postmenopausal women at high risk of fracture or those who have failed other therapies

name: Rydapt

name: Alunbrig
use: To treat patients with anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)-positive metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have progressed on or are intolerant to crizotinib

name: Brineura
use: To treat a specific form of Batten disease

name: Ingrezza
use: To treat adults with tardive dyskinesia

name: Zejula

use: To treat adults with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis

name: Emflaza

name: Parsabiv

name: Trulance
use: To treat Chronic Idiopathic Constipation (CIC) in adult patients

name: Savaysa
use: To reduce the risk of stroke and dangerous blood clots (systemic embolism) in patients with atrial fibrillation that is not caused by a heart valve problem

name: Cosentyx
use: To treat adults with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis

name: Natpara
use: To control hypocalcemia (low blood calcium levels) in patients with hypoparathyroidism

name: Ibrance
use: To treat advanced (metastatic) breast cancer

name: Lenvima
use: To treat patients with progressive, differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) whose disease progressed despite receiving radioactive iodine therapy (radioactive iodine refractory disease).

name: Farydak
use: To treat patients with multiple myeloma

name: Avycaz
use: To treat adults with complicated intra-abdominal infections (cIAI), in combination with metronidazole, and complicated urinary tract infections (cUTI), including kidney infections (pyelonephritis), who have limited or no alternative treatment options.

name: Cresemba
use: To treat adults with invasive aspergillosis and invasive mucormycosis, rare but serious infections

name: Unituxin
use: To treat pediatric patients with high-risk neuroblastoma

name: Cholbam
use: To treat pediatric and adult patients with bile acid synthesis disorders due to single enzyme defects, and for patients with peroxisomal disorders

name: Corlanor
use: To reduce hospitalization from worsening heart failure.

name: Kybella
use: To treat adults with moderate-to-severe fat below the chin, known as submental fat

name: Viberzi
use: To treat irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea (IBS-D) in adult men and women.

name: Kengreal
use: To prevent the formation of harmful blood clots in the coronary arteries for adult patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention

name: Orkambi
use: To treat cystic fibrosis

name: Entresto
use: To treat heart failure

name: Rexulti
use: To treat schizophrenia and as an add on to an antidepressant to treat major depressive disorder

name: Daklinza
use: To treat chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 3 infections

name: Odomzo
use: To treat patients with locally advanced basal cell carcinoma that has recurred following surgery or radiation therapy, or who are not candidates for surgery or radiation therapy.

name: Praluent
use: To treat certain patients with high cholesterol

name: Addyi
use: To treat acquired, generalized hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD) in premenopausal women

name: Repatha
use: To treat certain patients with high cholesterol

name: Varubi
use: To prevent delayed phase chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (emesis)

name: Xuriden
use: To treat patients with hereditary orotic aciduria

name: Vraylar
use: To treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder in adults

name: Lonsurf
use: To treat patients with an advanced form of colorectal cancer who are no longer responding to other therapies

name: Tresiba
use: To improve blood sugar (glucose) control in adults with diabetes mellitus

name: Aristada
use: To treat adults with schizophrenia

name: Praxbind
use: For use in patients who are taking the anticoagulant Pradaxa (dabigatran) during emergency situations when there is a need to reverse Pradaxa’s blood-thinning effects.

name: Veltassa
use: To treat hyperkalemia, a serious condition in which the amount of potassium in the blood is too high.

name: Strensiq
use: To treat perinatal, infantile and juvenile-onset hypophosphatasia (HPP).

name: Yondelis
use: To treat specific soft tissue sarcomas (STS) – liposarcoma and leiomyosarcoma – that cannot be removed by surgery (unresectable) or is advanced (metastatic).

name: Nucala
use: For use with other asthma medicines for the maintenance treatment of asthma in patients age 12 years and older.

name: Genvoya
ingredients: a fixed-dose combination tablet containing elvitegravir, cobicistat, emtricitabine, and tenofovir alafenamide
use: For use as a complete regimen for the treatment of HIV-1 infection in adults and pediatric patients 12 years of age and older

name: Cotellic
use: To be used in combination with vemurafenib to treat advanced melanoma that has spread to other parts of the body or can’t be removed by surgery, and that has a certain type of abnormal gene (BRAF V600E or V600K mutation)

name: Tagrisso
use: To treat certain patients with non-small cell lung cancer

name: Darzalex
use: To treat patients with multiple myeloma who have received at least three prior treatments.

name: Ninlaro
use: To treat people with multiple myeloma who have received at least one prior therapy

name: Portrazza
use: To treat patients with advanced (metastatic) squamous non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have not previously received medication specifically for treating their advanced lung cancer

name: Empliciti
use: To treat people with multiple myeloma who have received one to three prior medications

name: Kanuma
use: To treat patients with a rare disease known as lysosomal acid lipase (LAL) deficiency

name: Alecensa
use: To treat ALK-positive lung cancer

name: Bridion

name: Uptravi
use: To treat pulmonary arterial hypertension

name: Zurampic
use: To treat high blood uric acid levels associated with gout

name: Farxiga
use: To improve glycemic control, along with diet and exercise, in adults with type 2 diabetes

name: Hetlioz
use: To treat non-24- hour sleep-wake disorder (“non-24”) in totally blind individuals. Non-24 is a chronic circadian rhythm (body clock) disorder in the blind that causes problems with the timing of sleep.

name: Vimizim
use: Treatment for Mucopolysaccharidosis Type IVA (Morquio A syndrome)

name: Northera
use: To treat neurogenic orthostatic hypotension (NOH)

name: Myalept
use: To treat the complications of leptin deficiency

name: Neuraceq
use: For Positron EmissionTomography (PET) imaging of the brain

name: Impavido
use: To treat a tropical disease called leishmaniasis
innovationCategories: novel; various effects incl on AKT

name: Otezla
use: To treat adults with active psoriatic arthritis (PsA)
innovationCategories: novel; no other PDE4 inhibitor seems to have activity in arthritis (Roflumilast is approved for COPD)

name: Tanzeum
use: To improve glycemic control, along with diet and exercise, in adults with type 2 diabetes

name: Cyramza
use: To treat patients with advanced stomach cancer or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma
innovationCategories: novel; VEGF and VEGFR1 anitbodies exist

name: Sylvant
use: To treat patients with multicentric Castleman’s disease (MCD), a rare disorder similar to lymphoma (cancer of the lymph nodes)
innovationCategories: novel target, but just upstream of Tocilizumab

name: Zykadia
use: To treat patients with anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)-positive metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have progressed on or are intolerant to crizotinib
innovationCategories: Similar to others; crizotinib seems to have similar kinase profile

name: Zontivity
use: To reduce the risk of heart attacks and stroke in high-risk patients

name: Entyvio
use: To treat adult patients with moderate to severe ulcerative colitis and adult patients with moderate to severe Crohn‘s disease

name: Dalvance
use: To treat adults with skin infections
innovationCategories: Similar to others, a 2nd generation vancomycin

name: Jublia
use: Treat mild to moderate onychomycosis (fungal infection)

name: Sivextro
use: To treat adults with skin infections

name: Beleodaq
use: To treat patients with peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL)
innovationCategories: Similar to SAHA and other HDACis

name: Kerydin
use: For the topical treatment of onychomycosis of the toenails

name: Zydelig
use: (1) Relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), in combination with rituximab, in patients for whom rituximab alone would be considered appropriate therapy due to other co-morbidities; and (2) Relapsed small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) in patients who have received at least two prior systemic therapies; (3) Relapsed follicular B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (FL) in patients who have received at least two prior systemic therapies.
innovationCategories: novel; first approved against this target

name: Striverdi Respimat
use: To treat chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

name: Jardiance
use: To improve gylcemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes

name: Orbactiv
use: To treat adults with skin infections
innovationCategories: Similar to others, a 2nd generation vancomycin

name: Belsomra
use: To treat difficulty in falling and staying asleep (insomnia)
innovationCategories: novel; first approved against this target

name: Plegridy
use: For the treatment of patients with relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis

name: Cerdelga
use: For the long-term treatment of adult patients with the Type 1 form of Gaucher disease

name: Keytruda
use: For treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable melanoma who are no longer responding to other drugs.
innovationCategories: Pembrolizumab and Nivolumab are first to target PD-1

name: Movantik
use: To treat opioid-induced constipation in adults with chronic non-cancer pain.

name: Trulicity
use: To treat adults with type 2 diabetes.

name: Harvoni
use: To treat chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1 infection
innovationCategories: Same approach as other anti-HCV therapies

name: Akynzeo
use: To treat nausea and vomiting in patients undergoing cancer chemotherapy
modeOfAction: NK1 substance P receptor antagonist/5-HT3 receptor antagonist

name: Lumason
use: For patients whose ultrasound image of the heart (echocardiograms) are hard to see with ultrasound waves
innovationCategories: Similar to SonoVue, Optison and other contrast agents for ultrasound

name: Ofev
use: For the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF)
innovationCategories: perhaps novel use of kinase inhibitor for indication

name: Esbriet
use: For the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF)

name: Blincyto
use: To treat patients with Philadelphia chromosome-negative precursor B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-cell ALL)
innovationCategories: novel; CD19 is novel and mode is novel in directing the human immune system to act against tumor B cells

name: Xtoro
use: To treat acute otitis externa, commonly known as swimmer’s ear

name: Lynparza
use: To treat advanced ovarian cancer
innovationCategories: novel; first approved against this target

name: Viekira Pak
ingredients: (ombitasvir, paritaprevir and ritonavir tablets co-packaged with dasabuvir tablets)
use: To treat patients with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1 infection, including those with a type of advanced liver disease called cirrhosis
innovationCategories: Same approach as other anti-HCV therapies

name: Zerbaxa
use: To treat adults with complicated intra-abdominal infections (cIAI) and complicated urinary tract infections (cUTI)

name: Rapivab
use: To treat influenza infection in adults

name: Opdivo
use: To treat patients with unresectable (cannot be removed by surgery) or metastatic (advanced) melanoma who no longer respond to other drugs
innovationCategories: Pembrolizumab and Nivolumab are first to target PD-1

name: Nesina
use: To improve blood sugar control in adults with type 2 diabetes.

name: Kynamro
use: To treat patients with a rare type of high cholesterol called homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HoFH).

name: Pomalyst
use: To treat patients with multiple myeloma whose disease progressed after being treated with other cancer drugs.

name: Kadcyla
use: For patients with HER2-positive, late-stage (metastatic) breast cancer.

name: Osphena
use: To treat women experiencing moderate to severe dyspareunia (pain during sexual intercourse), a symptom of vulvar and vaginal atrophy due to menopause.

name: Lymphoseek
use: A radioactive diagnostic imaging agent that helps doctors locate lymph nodes in patients with breast cancer or melanoma who are undergoing surgery to remove tumor-draining lymph nodes.

name: Dotarem
use: For use in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain, spine and associated tissues of patients ages 2 years and older.

name: Tecfidera
use: To treat adults with relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis (MS).

name: Invokana
use: Used with diet and exercise, to improve glycemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes.

name: Breo Ellipta
ingredients: fluticasone furoate and vilanterol inhalation powder
use: For the long-term, once-daily, maintenance treatment of airflow obstruction in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), including chronic bronchitis and/or emphysema.

name: Xofigo
use: To treat men with symptomatic late-stage (metastatic) castration-resistant prostate cancer that has spread to bones but not to other organs.

name: Tafinlar
use: To treat patients with melanoma whose tumors express the BRAF V600E gene mutation.

name: Mekinist
use: To treat patients whose tumors express the BRAF V600E or V600K gene mutations.

name: Gilotrif
use: For patients with late stage (metastatic) non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) whose tumors express specific types of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) gene mutations, as detected by an FDA-approved test.

name: Tivicay
use: To treat HIV-1 infection.

name: Brintellix
use: To treat adults with major depressive disorder.

name: Duavee
use: To treat moderate-to-severe hot flashes (vasomotor symptoms) associated with menopause and to prevent osteoporosis after menopause.

name: Adempas
use: To treat adults with two forms of pulmonary hypertension.

name: Opsumit
use: To treat adults with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH), a chronic, progressive and debilitating disease that can lead to death or the need for lung transplantation.

name: Vizamyl
use: A radioactive diagnostic drug for use with positron emission tomography (PET) imaging of the brain in adults being evaluated for Alzheimer's disease (AD) and dementia.

name: Gazyva
use: For use in combination with chlorambucil to treat patients with previously untreated chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

name: Aptiom
use: As an add-on medication to treat seizures associated with epilepsy.

name: Imbruvica
use: To treat patients with mantle cell lymphoma (MCL), a rare and aggressive type of blood cancer.

name: Luzu
use: For the topical treatment of interdigital tinea pedis, tinea cruris, and tinea corporis caused by the organisms Trichophyton rubrum and Epidermophyton floccosum, in patients 18 years of age and older.

name: Olysio
use: To treat chronic hepatitis C virus infection.

name: Sovaldi
use: To treat chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

name: Anoro Ellipta
use: For the once-daily, long-term maintenance treatment of airflow obstruction in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Voraxaze
use: To treat patients with toxic levels of methotrexate in their blood due to kidney failure.

name: Picato
use: For the topical treatment of actinic keratosis.

name: Inlyta
use: To treat patients with advanced kidney cancer (renal cell carcinoma) who have not responded to another drug for this type of cancer.

name: Erivedge
use: To treat adult patients with basal cell carcinoma, the most common type of skin cancer.

name: Kalydeco
use: For the treatment of a rare form of cystic fibrosis (CF) in patients ages 6 years and older who have the specific G551D mutation in the Cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane Regulator (CFTR) gene.

name: Zioptan
use: For reducing elevated intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

name: Surfaxin
use: For the prevention of respiratory distress syndrome (RDS), a breathing disorder that affects premature infants.

name: Omontys
use: To treat anemia, a condition in which the body does not have enough healthy red blood cells, in adult dialysis patients who have chronic kidney disease (CKD).

name: Amyvid
use: Used as a radioactive diagnostic agent for Positron Emission Tomography (PET) imaging of the brain to estimate β-amyloid neuritic plaque density in adult patients with cognitive impairment who are being evaluated for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) and other causes of cognitive decline.

name: Stendra
use: To treat erectile dysfunction.

name: Elelyso
use: For long-term enzyme replacement therapy to treat a form of Gaucher disease, a rare genetic disorder

name: Perjeta
use: To treat patients with HER2-positive late-stage (metastatic) breast cancer.

name: Belviq
use: For chronic weight management.

name: Myrbetriq
use: To treat adults with overactive bladder.

name: Prepopik
ingredients: sodium picosulfate, magnesium oxide and citric acid
use: To help cleanse the colon in adults preparing for colonoscopy.

name: Kyprolis
use: To treat patients with multiple myeloma who have received at least two prior therapies, including treatment with Velcade (bortezomib) and an immunomodulatory.

name: Tudorza Pressair
use: For the long-term maintenance treatment of bronchospasm associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), including chronic bronchitis and emphysema.

name: Zaltrap
use: For use in combination with a FOLFIRI (folinic acid, fluorouracil and irinotecan) chemotherapy regimen to treat adults with colorectal cancer.

name: Stribild
ingredients: elvitegravir, cobicistat, emtricitabine, tenofovir disoproxil fumarate
use: A once-a-day combination pill to treat HIV-1 infection in adults who have never been treated for HIV infection.

name: Neutroval
use: To reduce the time certain patients receiving cancer chemotherapy experience severe neutropenia, a decrease in infection-fighting white blood cells called neutrophils.

name: Linzess
use: To treat chronic idiopathic constipation and to treat irritable bowel syndrome with constipation (IBS-C) in adults.

name: Xtandi
use: To treat men with late-stage (metastatic) castration-resistant prostate cancer that has spread or recurred, even with medical or surgical therapy to minimize testosterone.

name: Bosulif
use: To treat chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML), a blood and bone marrow disease that usually affects older adults.

name: Aubagio
use: For the treatment of adults with relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis (MS).

name: Choline C 11 Injection
use: A Positron Emission Tomography (PET) imaging agent used to help detect recurrent prostate cancer.

name: Stivarga
use: To treat patients with colorectal cancer that has progressed after treatment and spread to other parts of the body (metastatic).

name: Jetrea
use: To treat an eye condition called symptomatic vitreomacular adhesion (VMA).

name: Fycompa
use: To treat partial onset seizures in patients with epilepsy ages 12 years and older.

name: Synribo
use: To treat adults with chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML), a blood and bone marrow disease.

name: Xeljanz
use: To treat adults with moderately to severely active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who have had an inadequate response to, or who are intolerant of, methotrexate.

name: Cometriq
use: To treat medullary thyroid cancer that has spread to other parts of the body (metastasized).

name: Iclusig
use: To treat adults with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and Philadelphia chromosome positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia (Ph+ ALL), two rare blood and bone marrow diseases.

name: raxibacumab
use: To treat inhalational anthrax, a form of the infectious disease caused by breathing in the spores of the bacterium Bacillus anthracis.

name: Signifor
use: To treat Cushing’s disease patients who cannot be helped through surgery

name: Gattex
use: To treat adults with short bowel syndrome (SBS) who need additional nutrition from intravenous feeding (parenteral nutrition).

name: Juxtapid
use: To reduce low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, total cholesterol, apolipoprotein B, and non-high-density lipoprotein (non-HDL) cholesterol in patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HoFH).

name: Eliquis
use: To reduce the risk of stroke and dangerous blood clots (systemic embolism) in patients with atrial fibrillation that is not caused by a heart valve problem.

name: Sirturo
use: As part of combination therapy to treat adults with multi-drug resistant pulmonary tuberculosis (TB) when other alternatives are not available.

name: Fulyzaq
use: To treat HIV/AIDS patients whose diarrhea is not caused by an infection from a virus, bacteria, or parasite.
